i5.las2peer.logging

Class NodeStreamLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.logging.NodeObserver
      • i5.las2peer.logging.NodeStreamLogger

  • public class NodeStreamLogger
extends NodeObserver
    Simple stream bases implementation of a NodeObserver, e.g. for creating log files For id based log file names, it is possible to buffer a set of log messages and given the name of the log file afterwards. This is useful, e.g. because on pastry nodes, the first event will occur before the id of the node is set (by the pastry implementation itself)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class i5.las2peer.logging.NodeObserver

        NodeObserver.Event

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeStreamLogger()
      create a logger, first logging to a string buffer an writing everything after setting a log file name this method may be necessary e.g. for a PastryNodeImpl, which gets its node id after joining the p2p network and not at startup as the simple LocalNode implementation of a Node

      create a logger for the given file descriptor

      NodeStreamLogger(java.lang.String filename)

    • Method Detail

      • setOutputFile

        public void setOutputFile(java.lang.String filename)
                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        If no logfile or outputstream was given at constructor phase, every log message will be logged to a stringbuffer. This method may be used to specify a log file afterwards. All buffered log entries will be written directly to this file.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

           throws java.io.IOException

      • writeLog

        protected void writeLog(java.lang.Long timestamp,
                        NodeObserver.Event e,
                        java.lang.String sourceNode,
                        java.lang.Long sourceAgentId,
                        java.lang.String destinationNode,
                        java.lang.Long destinationAgentId,
                        java.lang.String remarks)
        Description copied from class: NodeObserver
        This method has to be implemented by any (non abstract) deriving class. Each call represents one event to log by this observer. All parameters except the time stamp and the event may be null.
        Specified by:
        writeLog in class NodeObserver
        Parameters:
        timestamp - UNIX time stamp of the event
        e - the event to log
        sourceNode - a source (p2p) node of the event (e.g. message sender)
        sourceAgentId - a source (las2peer) agent of the event (e.g. message sender)
        destinationNode - a destination (p2p) node for the event (e.g. message receiver)
        destinationAgentId - a destination (las2peer) agent of the event (e.g. message receiver)
        remarks - (optional) additional remarks
